timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -53,33 +69,22 @@ private static BuildFileSpec toBuildFileSpec(
    *
    * @param projectRoot the root context directory of this build
    * @param buildFilePath a file containing the build definition
-   * @param templateParameters a map of templating variables to apply on the file before parsing
+   * @param buildOptions the build configuration from the command line

replies.bodyText: I could add en example, but not sure what you're for an example of?
replies.author: loosebazooka

replies.bodyText: Oops I totally missed that buildOptions was of type JibCli.  Adding an example is probably not useful here. Should the name be a more general, like cliOptions, if JibCli also includes things like verbosity and console?
replies.author: mpeddada1

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
@Rule public MockitoRule rule = MockitoJUnit.rule();
@Mock ConsoleLogger consoleLogger;
@Mock JibCli jibCli;
@Rule public final MockitoRule rule = MockitoJUnit.rule();
@Mock private ConsoleLogger consoleLogger;
@Mock private JibCli jibCli;
timeline.author: chanseokoh

timeline.body:
The iteration order is actually important. Internally we used `LinkedHashSet` everywhere to preserve the order while conveniently removing duplicates (also signifying that duplicates can't exist). However, I see that it can easily make the Jib API user to mess up with the order. Maybe accepting a `Set` wasn't a good idea.

Anyways, the question is, would `Collectors.toSet()` preserve the insertion order?
timeline.bodyText:
The iteration order is actually important. Internally we used LinkedHashSet everywhere to preserve the order while conveniently removing duplicates (also signifying that duplicates can't exist). However, I see that it can easily make the Jib API user to mess up with the order. Maybe accepting a Set wasn't a good idea.
Anyways, the question is, would Collectors.toSet() preserve the insertion order?
timeline.bodyHTML:
The iteration order is actually important. Internally we used LinkedHashSet everywhere to preserve the order while conveniently removing duplicates (also signifying that duplicates can't exist). However, I see that it can easily make the Jib API user to mess up with the order. Maybe accepting a Set wasn't a good idea.

Anyways, the question is, would Collectors.toSet() preserve the insertion order?
timeline.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: no but I think I can do: Collectors.toCollection(LinkedHashSet::new)
replies.author: loosebazooka

replies.bodyText: Why does the order matter? for selecting defaults?
replies.author: loosebazooka

replies.bodyText: jib-core will create a manifest list with the given platform order.
replies.author: chanseokoh
